name: Pope Urban IV
summary: Urban IV, born Jacques Pantaléon, was Pope from 1261 to 1264. He was French and had been Patriarch of Jerusalem before his election. He is best known for establishing the feast of Corpus Christi in 1264, following the visions of St. Juliana of Liège. He worked to resolve conflicts in Italy and supported Charles of Anjou's claim to the Kingdom of Sicily. His pontificate was marked by ongoing political struggles in Italy and attempts to restore papal authority.
